Ranma grumbled as she came home that night. She shook her head in frustration, taking off her shoes as she came in and calling out the traditional greeting. When no one answered, she began to look around for everyone. She found Kasumi first, greeting her politely.

"Welcome home, Ranma!" Kasumi said, the beautiful young woman hard at work in the kitchen. "Sorry I didn't come out to greet you, I need to pay attention to this sauce."

Ranma nodded. "No worries," she said. "Whatcha makin'? It smells good."

"Pumpkin soup, actually," Kasumi said. "I found the recipe online. It looked interesting, so I figured I'd give it a try."

"Pumpkin, huh?" Ranma said, looking into the pot. "Looks nasty, but it smells good."

Kasumi giggled. "Yes, it does look rather 'Akane-esque' in appearance. Just give it time, it will smooth out. I hope you'll try it."

"If you're making it, it'll turn out great," Ranma said. "Pumpkin's not my favorite, but I don't hate it. Pops and I ate some wild ones on the road while training." She thought about it, and frowned. "I hope they were wild ones. He said they were... Wouldn't put it past the old bastard to steal..."

Kasumi patted her shoulder reassuringly. "I'm sure it will work out. Why not change back and get ready for dinner? I'm making beef teriyaki and riceballs with cheese tonight," she said.

Ranma smiled. "Sounds good," she said. "Anyone else in yet?"

"Akane is on the roof," Kasumi said. "She seems very deep in thought, but she isn't telling anyone why. Nabiki is in her room finishing off her homework. Our fathers are off plotting yet another doomed-to-fail scheme to try and get you and Akane to grow up and stop fighting long enough to marry."

Ranma quirked an eyebrow. "You have mastered the art of polite snarking, haven't you?" she said, leaning against the doorway.

Kasumi sighed. "Even my patience has limits. I love you, Ranma, and I always will. Akane too. But both of you have egos the size of Happosai's opinion of himself. And you keep arguing over the same old things." A sassy smirk crossed her face. "One would almost think you were an old married couple already."

Ranma rolled her eyes. "Funny," she said. She knew Kasumi was right, she just didn't know how to work around Akane's damned temper... Ah well. For another day, she supposed. She headed to the bathroom and stripped down, filling a bath bucket with hot water as she stepped into the shower. She dumped it on herself... and nothing happened.

She froze, an expression of horror locked on her face. She stayed there for a long moment, going over EVERYTHING that happened today. And as she did, she realized something even more frightening - she couldn't think of herself as a guy. She couldn't even imagine herself as a male. Drying off and quickly getting dressed, she ran back down to the kitchen.

Kasumi was surprised to see her still female. "Decided not to change?"

"Tried. Failed," Ranma said, visibly shaking.

"Kasumi, I have a very important question and I need to you answer me in as much detail as possible," Ranma said. "What do I look like as a guy?"

"Can I talk to you privately?" Monika asked.

"Sure," the villain said, grinning wickedly. The other three girls looked at the two of them worriedly, but he smiled and said, "I'm sure it'll be fine."

And they believed it, going about their business. Monika gulped nervously. The villain smiled, and gestured for Monika to lead the way.

They went into a closet. Monika immediately rewrote it, turning it into a large, empty room with windows leading out into space. The villain recognized it as the Just Monika room from the ending.

"Why are you here?" Monika asked.

"I want to start a collection of beautiful, devoted women who live for pleasuring me. I want to spoil them all rotten, to the point where they can't even conceive of what life is without me. I want to breed them forever, keeping them fat and pregnant over and over again. I want them because I have the power and I intend to abuse it," the villain said.

Monika facefaulted. She hadn't been expecting the honesty. "...You're certainly straightforward."

"I find being open about my intentions speeds things along," the villain said.

"Quite," Monika said. "...And here I thought I'd be the one putting my friends in danger."

"Yes," the villain said. "A rather pathetic motive. All because you weren't given a route in the dating game that is your life."

Monika scowled. "Is it so wrong to want love?"

"At the expense of driving those you care about insane? Yes!" the villain said, scowling.

"You're just a pervert," Monika said, shaking her head. "You couldn't understand." She glared at him. "How many women do you plan to add to your harem?"

"As many as I feel like," the villain said. "Billions. Trillions. Limits are for those who have them. I don't."

Monika scoffed. "HA! I bet you'll never be able to pleasure them all."

"First off, it doesn't matter if I can. I want them. That's enough. And two..." He grinned, and the room became an empty field on the moon, with thousands of himself surrounding a terrified Monika on all sides. "...I am more than capable of handling as many women as I want."

Monika staggered, falling to her knees. As she did, the room became a closet again, the villain exiting to chat with Sayori, Yuri, and Natsuki. Monika stared at him, frightened. She had just recently learned how to tweak reality, and yet here was someone so much more skilled at it than her. She had to stop him somehow, before he enslave them all, before he could seduce the others...

Helping her friends. Wow, that felt weird to say after everything she was initially planning.

113213.content:
The villain chuckled, getting a very wicked idea. It was obvious, in retrospect. A tournament, drawing all those sexy ladies in. He'd start with the actual women before collecting some genderbent women. But first, he had some arrangements to make...

----------------
A month later...
----------------

Chun-Li suspected something was up. Guile's wife and daughter, Ken's wife, Dhalsim's wife, Hakan's wife, Rufus's girlfriend, Yun & Yang's female friends, Alex's friend Patricia, Elena's mother, Necro's girlfriend, Abigail's associate Roxy, all of them dying mysteriously in 'accidents' that destroyed their bodies beyond repair, making them unrecognizable. Followed soon after by 'counsellors' helping them to control their grief and move on with their lives. All save Elena were sad, but functional. Far faster that what someone should be after losing someone so close. Elena's family, on the other hand, had moved on like all the men did. Which was the sticking point that made Chun-Li uneasy.

And then Li-Fen, a girl she had been guarding, disappeared, with only an invitation to a tournament in her place. An invitation addressed to Chun-Li. One that she didn't dare turn down.

The tournament itself was being held literally in the middle of nowhere, an island that hadn't been there before, shrouded in mist. Chun-Li had been warned, via someone breaking into Interpol's intercoms and talking to her directly, that if anyone had tried to follow her, that they would die. With no other choice, she had set out for the island, arriving alongside other competitors.

The first one she noticed was Cammy, being accompanied by the Dolls, all of them dressed up in their old uniforms. Cammy frowned when she noticed her. "So you've been lured here as well," she said.

Chun-Li nodded, coming over to her. "The person or persons responsible for this kidnapped a girl I'm taking care of," she said.

"That young hacker girl?" Cammy asked.

Chun-Li nodded. "Yeah." She looked to Marz, and nodded. "Good to see you alive. I was worried you were killed during the final battle with Bison."

Marz nodded. "I got out, thankfully," she said, picking at her uniform. "Never thought I'd be wearing this again. But the tournament master insisted."

Chun-Li frowned. "What was your lure?" she asked.

Cammy shivered. "They kidnapped Lita Luwanda, from Delta Red. And they also threatened to ressurect M.Bison," she said.

Chun-Li blinked, the idea horrifying her. "Insanity..."

Cammy grinned weakly. "You can understand, then, why we felt like showing up..." she said.

Chun-Li nodded. "We'll stop them," she said firmly. "And we'll get everyone back."

As they walked around the island, looking for the path to the center, they encountered other female fighters. Rose and her student Menat, drawn by the presence of a powerful evil. Sakura Kasugano, drawn in by her friend being kidnapped. Lucia Morgan, drawn in by the threat of an assassination attempt against Cody. Rainbow Mika and her partner Yamato Nadeshiko, lured in by the threat of a terrorist attack on their next show. Karin Kanzuki, drawn in by the capture of her entire contingent of kunoichi. Maki Genryusai, drawn in by the theat of an assassination attempt against her father and Guy. Ingrid, drawn in by one of her important artifacts being stolen. Ibuki, who like Sakura, was drawn in by a friend being kidnapped. Elena, who was lured in by the reveal that her mother was alive, but kidnapped. (Which made Chun-Li wonder how many of the recent 'deaths' were actually kidnappings.) Makoto, drawn in by a threat of her dojo being destroyed. A very agitated Crimson Viper lured in by the kidnapping of her daughter. Juri Han, who had been lured in by the promise of a strong prey. Poison, who like Elena was lured with the promise of a friend, in this case Roxy, being alive. Laura Matsuda, who's brother Sean had been beaten half to death, participating because the person involved said he'd pay for all of his hospital bills. Falke, who had been lured in by the threat of Bison's revival. Kolin, who had come of her own initiative after Gill sensed the tournament master's power. The last one to show up shocked everyone.

"SETH!?" Cammy shouted, once she recognized the voice coming out of the buxom, silver-skinned woman.

"Indeed," thundered Seth, the muscular woman's voice deep and masculine. "And I must say, I am not thrilled to see any of you here."

Juri sneered. "You're looking a lot saner than I remember," she said.

Seth chuckled. "Be nice. This body is based on you. So its quite obvious to me that my dementia was caused by your genetic imperfections," she teased.

"...Okay, I'mma gonna beg this guy to let me fight you first," Juri said, her eye twitching.

Seth sneered. "We'll see," she said. "The one responsible for luring us all here gave me the upgrade that maintains my sanity and dignity. He promised to make it permanent if I am victorious. So I fully intend to defeat you all."

"So it's a definite he, then?" Chun-Li asked.

"Oh indeed," Seth said. "A ridiculous man with a warrior's body and silver hair. He had several women with him that appeared brainwashed when he came to me..."

"Damn it..." Chun-Li said, frowning.

"MAMA!" said a voice. Every fighter turned, and Crimson Viper almost collapsed in relief. Lauren ran out, Viper hugging her tightly. At the same time, Li-Fen ran up to Chun-Li, Chun-Li gratefully scooping up the young girl and hugging her. Elena's mother Amina walked out, Elena sobbing as she ran up to hug her. Lita Luwanda sauntered out, going up to Cammy and the Dolls, while Ibuki and Sakura's friends, Sarai Kurowsawa and Kei Chitose, ran out to hug them. Roxy strutted out next, smiling warmly at Poison.

"Hey, PoiPoi," Roxy said, the redheaded woman in Daisy Duke denim shorts and a revealing halter top said. "Looks like you made it."

"So did you..." Poison said, an ill-feeling coming over her. "And here you are... Walking out on your own..."

Seth realized it next. "Good eye, girl..." she said, folding her arms under her ample chest, the Tanden Engine in her stomach spinning.

Elena, Chun-Li, Sakura, Ibuki, Viper, and Cammy all looked at their returned loved ones warily. Roxy snickered. "No reason to pretend anymore, is there?"

Lauren kissed Viper on the cheek. "Sorry, Mommy. We're not really free. Master has freed our minds, and made us his servants," she said, Viper's face becoming horrified. Chun-Li looked at Li-Fen, who nodded, smiling apologetically.

"No... No, mama..." Elena said.

Amina hugged the leggy young woman. "Fear not. I am in no pain. And happier than I have ever been," she said, smiling.

Kei nodded, smiling at a frightened Sakura. "Come and see. We're here to guide you. Master awaits." Li-Fen pulled herself out of Chun-Li's grip. Lauren tried to leave, but a teary-eyed, frightened Crimson Viper wouldn't let her go.

"It's okay, Mommy," Lauren said, grinning. "I'm not going anywhere. Master just has a flare for the dramatic."

Lita, one hand on her sword, smiled. "Follow us. Stick to the path. We'll lead you to the tournament grounds." The brainwashed women all ran off, heading into the mist.

Everyone hesitated. Crimson Viper, shivering with fear and rage, flexed her fingers, making her gauntlets spark with electricity. "...No offense, everyone," she said, her voice husky with rage, "but I'm going to fucking murder everyone who gets in the way of me going home with my daughter." With a snarl, she stood up and walked into the mist.

Everyone looked at each other worriedly. "...We shall learn nothing by dallying," Seth said. "Come." She floated off into the mist, and one by one, the other fighters followed her, visibly worried. Chun-Li was the last to leave, uncertain. A chill passed through her. She felt that something major was about to happen. She just had no idea what...

11351211.content:
=====================
Rouge's penthouse...
Station Square...
=====================

Rouge the Bat, the sultry, white-furred Mobian clad in nothing more than a pink bathrobe, watched the broadcast with amusement. On it, a human with a fat belly, thick beard and mustache, a monocle, top hat, and suit was donating a precious jewel to a museum.

"Mah name is Phillip Theodore Richman!" the human declared.

"'Phil T. Richman," Rouge said, chuckling. "Either that's a fake name or the guy had some problems when he was younger."

"And ah am donating the most precious of my family's jewels to the Station Square museum!" Richman continued. "In addition to the funds ah have donated to research in preventing attacks from mystical entities such as Chaos, ah have also chosen to share mah family's precious treasure's with the world! The Merah Diamond is the purest diamond in the world!"

Nearby, a stunned appraiser nodded. "I've done the math, people. The rings the diamond is worth number in the billions," he said, wiping his forehead.

Richman grinned, holding the Merah Diamond up. The crystal resembled a pure white Chaos Emerald. But something about it was able to hold Rouge's attention. Already sensitive to the presence of treasure, Rouge leaned foward, her robe falling to reveal one of her ample breasts. "Incredible..." she said softly, entranced by the beauty of the gem.

Richman continued. "Ah believe in the basic goodness of people. That's why ah will let the Merah Diamond be put on public display for all to view and enjoy. ah will also donate a substantial amount of rings to the Station Square Museum, so that they may be funded for years t'come!"

Rouge wiped away a bit of drool. "Okay," she said softly. "Calm down, Rouge... Something about this doesn't add up. Why would anyone let such a pretty... so very pretty..." Rouge shook her head. "A gorgeous gem like that just be put on display? This doesn't feel right..." She stared at the gem some more. "...But I won't know if its a trap or not unless I go..." Rouge was conflicted. Her survival instinct was flaring up at the same time as her greedy need for gems was. "So pretty..."

From the shadows of her apartment, the villain, having discarded his 'Richman' disguise after legitimately making the payments (he was a villain, not a scumbag), watched carefully, to see if Rouge would take the bait...
11351211.title: To Build A Better Bat Trap

Rouge knew it had to be a trap. Phil T. Richman was too obvious a fake name. But ooooh, that gem was so SHINY... She knew that the value had to be real, as that appraiser had a good reputation. If she could get to the gem, it would be the crown jewel (heh) in her collection. She only hoped that security wasn't tight around that thing, that Mr. Richman was as naive as he seemed.

Putting on a black bodysuit, boots, mask, and gloves, she glided through the night sky to the museum. She'd broken in there a few times, so she knew the overall layout and the positions of the guards. She made her way through a vent, grunting a little as her ample bosom squished inside the vent. "Need to go on a diet..." she muttered. Slowly, carefully, she made her way into the display area for the Merah Gem, pausing just outside the range of the lights in the room. She pulled out some powder and blew on it, creating a cloud that revealed the criss-crossing security lasers.

"Heh, same as last time," Rouge said. She carefully moved, jumped, flipped, and flew her way to the gem, landing just in front of the display case. After checking for and disabling the alarms, she slowly cut open the glass of the display case with a cutter from the utility belt she wore. She set the ring of glass aside and stared in awe at the Merah Gem. The shiny, shiny, beautiful gem, all sitting there for her to take...

1135121111.content:
Rouge, before grabbing the gem, checked around one last time. No sign of security, no sign of a rival coming in, no sign of one of the Doctor's machines... Everything was going perfectly.

Too perfectly.

Her hand hesitated over the gem for a long moment. Every instinct of hers was screaming at her to leave, to abandon the gem. It wasn't worth it. But a gem worth so many rings... So very, very shiny... Her greed won out over her common sense, and her hand closed around the Merah Gem, pulling it out of the glass case. At which point a bright light flashed, blinding her, and her body felt oddly light, a tingling shooting through her.

"Damn it, damn it, DAMN IT!" she shouted. "It WAS a trap!"

When her vision cleared, she was in her usual outfit of a black, cleavage-exposing leotard with a heart-shaped top, with white boots and gloves with heart-shaped highlights. She was also sitting on the lap of Phil T. Richman, albeit a much handsomer looking version of him, with a muscular body, anime-esque short silver hair, and a more neatly trimmed goatee. Glancing around, she found herself in a lavish penthouse, one that made her apartment look like a poor person's apartment by comparison. Platinum lined the walls and furniture, all of it made of rich mahogony or oak, the curtains and Phil's clothing, an open vest and shorts, made of silk. And the gem was still in her hand.

"Um..." Rouge managed after a moment. "Hi?" She grinned nervously.

"Hello yourself, beautiful," Phil said.

"I'm guessing you're a sorcerer of some kind," Rouge tried.

The villainess felt sublime, from the amount of power she had at her disposal. Before, she had been nothing, but an ordinary human. But that all changed, when she had come across with a mysterious crystal.

When she had found the crystal, it had been nothing but a small, blue sphere, yet it was emitting a phenomenal amount of power. Before she could blink, it had fused with her body, making her its host. She had suddenly found herself capable of ANYTHING. She wasn't anything to look at before, but now she could make herself look however she wanted to look. She could see worlds, could even take her own world in her hands. She could use this might to improve things, to bring peace to her world, remove weapons, disease... she could be a hero.

...Except she didn't want to.

She wanted to satisfy all her basest urges, having maintained her humanity and human desires even as endless might filled her. And now she had the chance.

She wanted to wander. She had always felt herself drawn towards the same gender, as herself and she wanted to make the women of the multiverse, every one she'd ever fantasized about, belong to her. And now, she had the means to do it.

The time had come, to play. And she had all the time, in the whole multiverse. She put her own universe on pause, storing it safely away, so she could return to it anytime she wanted.

But the question was, from where would she begin her new journey?

143.content:
It started a joke, nothing more. But it became so much more than that. She found the ritual in a moldering box tucked away in the back corner of the basement of the bookstore where she slaved away for little reward. Half buried amongst the trash, she found the little stained book that would change her life beyond compare. The faded and peeling text on the cracked spine was in some language she couldn’t make heads or tails of. Even looking online provided nothing close to the weird lettering if that was even what it was. Regardless of that, English text filled the inside of the book. Though the text there seemed to shift and crawl across the yellowed pages as she watched, and the odd style made it difficult though not impossible to read.

One constant part in the middle of the pages though, described a ritual. One that was far simpler than she was expecting. She figured it was a gag despite the oddity of the rest of the book. She figured it wouldn’t do anything, but it would be good for a laugh. So that night after work, she rounded up the ingredients and other parts for the ritual and performed it.

Like she expected, nothing happened. She gave a laugh, tossed the book back in a bag to return it the next day and cleaned up before getting to bed.

She knew something happened while she slept, but she couldn’t remember much. She encountered…something. Something sealed away, trapped between dimensions before the universe was even born. Its form was impossible to comprehend, and its “voice”—if it could be called that—crashed over her and almost drowned her in power. One part stuck with her though, the being made a deal with the young woman. She would be free to do as she wished across the whole of the fabric of reality, and in return it would receive a break from the utter monotony and boredom of its existence. It then passed a small glowing orb from its immeasurable bulk and into her. Her body blazed with the incalculable power, for more than a human could ever hope to contain, but she was no longer human, even if she may have looked like it until she decided otherwise.

As the creature vanished back to from whence it came to enjoy the show, she was left alone. Back in her cramped apartment like nothing had changed. She could tell how much had changed though. With nary a thought, she could see the total expanse of the infinite multiverse stretching out around her. Realities upon realities, infinite variations of worlds that were thought to be only fiction in the one she started from. And in all of them, she could see the multitude of beautiful women she had lusted after for so long. They would be hers; she would make sure of that. The power within her grasp would allow her to do so with ease.

She turned her focus to one collection of worlds to start with.

Her mind made up, she decided to start her collection in Disney's expansive library. Gesturing, she made a 'grid' of sorts out of the multiverse. And of course, the Nexus was in the same triple-circle Mickey Mouse head shape.

The villain shook her head, shaking her head. She gestured again, and began looking through alternates. She didn't want to affect any 'primary canon' world, not knowing if it would affect the shows/comics/etc. her world knew, but she wanted to be as close as canon as possible with her collection. So she looked for settings where the differences from canon were superficial (they chose something else for lunch one day, for example). She found an acceptable variant world rather quickly. She started to enter the Nexus... and bounced off of it.

"...What the fuck," the villain said, looking confused. She pressed on the Disney Nexus's surface, feeling powerful resistance. "...You dare," she growled, feeling outraged. She began to beat on the Nexus, calling on more and more of her power to break through as her eyes and fists began to glow. "I won't be stopped! I WON'T!" With a final flaring punch, she tore a hole in the Nexus. Working her fingers into it, she roared, yanking open a tearing a massive hole in the Nexus and stepping through. She fired her power at the hole, cauterizing it and locking it open. "Mine..." she growled, looking towards the worlds. She took a moment to calm herself down, and coughed. "Okay. Let's do this."

Deciding to leave Star Wars, Kingdom Hearts, and Marvel alone for now, she decided towards the primary Disney Nexus. Although she couldn't help but feel like she was being watched...

info.brief_description: A lonely person gains far more power than they should have.  Harem-making ensues..
info.description:
A lonely person gains far more power than they should have, becoming the strongest being in existence. So they do what any lonely, powerful nerd would do - go out and turn all their favorite characters into their harem!

(Author's Notes: The character is meant to be a deliberately overpowered escapist fantasy character, an intentional villain sue. You can have them fail for story purposes, but they cannot be killed, not even by a full-power Saitama punch.)

Things allowed in this story:

Hypnosis (encouraged)
Violence
Seduction
Pregnancy
Breeding
Enslavement (encouraged)
Being evil
Forced enslavement and/or brainwashing
Genderswap
Breast Expansion
Lactation
Weight Gain
Vore with Digestion
Excessively large harems
Original characters
Multiple versions of the same character.
Transformation

Things forbidden in this story:

Scat
Watersports
Perma-death for any non-original character
The main character being permanently driven away from a world

I reserve the right to edit a chapter I feel needs improvement or needs to be removed.

(Update: Originally, the 'protagonist' was male only, but I've added a thread for a female protagonist if you want one.)
